1. Best Time To Visit Kerala

Summer (April - June)

With the hot climate and night showers adding humidity to the climate, the late spring season can't be recommended for a Kerala vacation. The temperature floating between 32 degrees and 36 degrees Celsius, makes it one of the hottest times in the area. However, this can be the best time for a budget travel plan and thus you can book Kerala travel packages, and can visit lovely hill stations like Idukki, Munnar, Palakkad, and Wayanad with the best Kerala vacation packages.

‚Ä¢ Puttu and Kadala Curry - Puttu is normally served beside kadala curry which is basically dark chickpeas.

1. Shimla Tour Packages : Best Time To Visit Shimla

Queen of hills, Shimla is a beautiful hill station situated at an elevation of 2202 meters above ocean level. Because of its area and beautiful scenery, Shimla has been a famous vacation destination for a very long time. Consistently, various travelers rush to Shimla by booking the Shimla holiday tour packages ahead of time to partake in its beauty. Whether you need to visit the city for a sense of peace or to explore various activities, you might potentially do both of them with our Shimla budget tour packages. In spite of the fact that you can enjoy pleasant weather in Shimla throughout the year.

March - June

Shimla appreciates the summer season from the long periods of Spring to June. Summer in Shimla isn't that blistering when contrasted with different states in India. The weather conditions stay charming and a lot of sightseers come here during this time with Shimla holiday tour packages, particularly to appreciate the beauty of Shimla. It is otherwise also known as the peak season for tourists and those who are looking for affordable options, can check out our Shimla budget tour packages. The temperature changes somewhere in the range of 15¬∞C and 30¬∞C. If you wish to enjoy paragliding or traveling or setting up camp, or want to try other adventurous activities, then don‚Äôt forget to include these in your Shimla holiday tour packages. A portion of the spots to appreciate sports activities during summer in Shimla are Naldehra, Kufri, Chharabra, and Narkanda. It is ideal to include these absolute best places in your Shimla holiday tour packages itinerary, for example, Glenn, Jakhoo Sanctuary, Christ Church, and Tara Devi Sanctuary.

July - September

The months of July and September are known as the stormy season in Shimla. Despite the fact that Shimla is situated at a height and doesn't encounter all the environmental change finally, still, a difference in season can be capable during the appearance of storms. The temperature during a storm fluctuates between 15¬∞C and 25¬∞C, making the environment cold and damp. So, in mid-July and August you can plan your Shimla trip with our Shimla holiday tour packages. It is viewed as a great time for those honeymooners who are searching for a peaceful holiday in a hill station with affordable Shimla budget tour packages. There might be chances of a landslide, so, it isn't recommended to try out adventure activities during this season. If you are planning a trip to Shimla, you should book our trip packages for Shimla ahead of time.

October - February

The months between October to February are known as the winter season in Shimla and this is the best time to book your Shimla holiday tour packages. The winter season begins with the period of October and goes on till the long stretch of February. As Shimla is a hill station, it encounters a chilly climate most of the time with recorded temperature between 0¬∞ C - 17¬∞ C. It is a magnificent sight to see the snow-shrouded mountain peaks. This is a perfect chance to visit Shimla with our Shimla holiday tour packages. It is likewise an ideal chance to try your hands out on adventure activities, for example, skiing and ice skating, so, don‚Äôt forget to include these activities in your trip packages for Shimla. Places like Annandale, Kali Bari Sanctuary, Lakka bazaar, Viceregal lodge, and others act as wonderful touring choices during winter. Don't forget to explore our Shimla budget tour packages for a hassle-free and affordable vacation to book one. This is the peak season, so, it is recommended to book your trip packages for Shimla ahead of time with our Shimla holiday tour packages.

2. How To Reach Shimla

By Train

The Toy Train is one more famous means of transport that runs from Kalka to Shimla railway Station, covering a distance of around 69 kilometers in 7 hours. Kalka, thus, is the closest railhead, which is connected with Chandigarh and Delhi by ordinary trains. You can take the Kalka Shatabdi, which goes from New Delhi station to the Kalka railway station through Chandigarh. Don‚Äôt forget to book the Shimla holiday tour packages ahead of time.

By Road

Travelers can likewise select to go by street. Shimla is all around connected with Chandigarh and Delhi through the street. A road trip to Shimla takes you through pleasant scenes of the Kalka Shimla highway that slices through the extravagant piles of the Himalayas. Shimla has extraordinary roads which are very much connected with major urban cities in India. You can choose government transport and limit the Shimla trip cost and arrive at the destination. If you are planning a trip to this peaceful heaven then you are recommended to check out our Shimla holiday tour packages. We have the best & affordable Shimla budget tour packages Look at the trip packages for Shimla that we offer, and get set on your way to this beautiful & exciting Shimla Trip.

3. Famous Food of Shimla - You Must Try

Trying the flavors of famous Shimla dishes on your Shimla trip with our Shimla holiday tour packages is an experience that will leave you begging for more. These are some of the famous dishes of Shimla and drinks to take care of your taste buds. Thus, on your next Shimla trip with our delightful Shimla holiday tour packages, don't miss out on the mouth-watering food that they offer you.

‚Ä¢ Madra - The dish is mostly made of chickpeas or veggies which are cooked well in oil and various flavourful spices.

‚Ä¢ Dhaam - The dish is made of rice, dal, rajma, curd, and boor ki Kadi as well as is perhaps completed with gur (jaggery).

‚Ä¢ Sidu - Sidu is a famous bread made from wheat dough with yeast, crushed green peas, peanuts, paneer, and walnut is normally paired with dal, ghee, and green chutney.

‚Ä¢ Thukpa - A noodle soup of Tibetan, Thukpa can be ready with both veggies and non-veg options. The hot meal is paired up with garlic ginger paste, chili, and sauces.

‚Ä¢ Babru - Babru resembles a Himachali variety of the famous kachoris. These patties are rolled and deep-fried in oil. Served with tamarind chutney.

‚Ä¢ Chha Gosht - Chha Gosht is a dish that is made with lamb meat and prepared in a sauce of gram flour, yogurt as well as flavors.

‚Ä¢ Mash Dal - Mash daal is made with split black lentils, It is soaked overnight, pressure cooked and after that cooked with very finely cut onions, ginger, garlic, and a mustard oil tadka.

‚Ä¢ Chicken Anardana - The unique chicken dish is made with a smokiness of flavor and served with paranthas or triangle flatbreads.

Rajasthan Tour Package

Explore the land of maharajas by booking Rajasthan tour packages. Your travels can be a luxurious experience with the revered cultural heritage of Rajasthan. Explore the city of forts, palaces, art, and culture with your Rajasthan tour packages from Delhi.
longpackagedesc:
1. Best Time To Visit Rajasthan

The best times to go to Rajasthan are from October to February when the weather is nice and humid. It should be noted that December and January in arid areas are very frigid. Summer should be avoided i.e., from April to August because it is very hot throughout Rajasthan.

However, festivals are celebrated throughout the State in various locations which attract travelers. If you want to enjoy these festivals all year round, you must check out Rajasthan tour packages.

Winter Season

Rajasthan has an impressive climate and is an excellent time to visit it from October to February when temperatures are low at the night and mostly mild during the day. You'll also be able to enjoy the exciting festivities that abound during this season on the Rajasthan holiday trip.

Monsoon Season

The monsoon season in Rajasthan is a beautiful sight. Aravali hills are greener and the hill stations here are beautiful. Mount Abu, Udaipur, Kumbhalgarh, and Kota are excellent tourist spots this time of year. You can customize your Rajasthan tour packages accordingly.

Summer Season

If you are planning to visit in summer, you will get to endure the harsh heat and scorching sun during summer. If you're preparing to go to Rajasthan during June, the most excellent area you can visit is the hill station, Mount Abu, due to the cozy weather at this hill station is thus perfect for sightseeing. Plan a holiday at any time of the year you want to, do check out our affordable range of Rajasthan tour packages.

2. How To Reach Rajasthan?

Rajasthan is home to miraculously beautiful areas and gorgeous tourist landmarks. See the grandeur of royalty by visiting historic forts and palaces. The state is well connected by many means, making it simple to plan a Rajasthan holiday trip.

By Air

Jaipur has one international airport that is the central hub for several Indian cities. So arrive in Rajasthan by booking your Rajasthan tour packages from Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore, and other main cities to enjoy your precious time and energy on your journey.

By Train

NH8 is Rajasthan's most frequently traveled highway, connecting Delhi, Udaipur, Jaipur, Vadodara, Ahmedabad, Mumbai, and other cities.

By Road

Being very much associated with neighboring states through roadways, it has three significant parkways: NH 17, NH 47, and NH 49 which make it simple for explorers to visit Kerala by road. Besides hiring a taxi or choosing a road tour, one can likewise board a private or government transport from significant cities of India to arrive at Kerala.

3. Famous Dishes Of Rajasthan

This royal land is a gourmet paradise full of exquisite dishes. Rajasthani cuisine is an unbelievably tasty delicacy that has assortments of meal items. Must-try these dishes while on a trip with your Rajasthan tour packages from Delhi.

‚Ä¢ Dal Bati Churma - Crispy bati is usually enjoyed with ghee and daal along with spices and sweet churma.

‚Ä¢ Mohan Thaal - Mohan Thaal is an unusual sweet dish typical to Rajasthan and made from besan. The rich aroma and pure taste of ghee only add to its appeal!

‚Ä¢ Laal Maas - Meat is immersed in a flavorful gravy made of tomatoes, red peppers, and sizzling spices.

‚Ä¢ Mawa Kachori - kachoris made of mawa and crispy dry fruits. These kachoris are a delicious breakfast option popular in Rajasthan.

‚Ä¢ Mirchi Bada - Mirchi bada is a delicious snack to complement afternoon tea. The hot and spicy badas are savory to eat.

‚Ä¢ Mohan Maas - Meat is filled with dry fruits, cooked in milk and cream, and then garnished with cardamom and cinnamon.

‚Ä¢ Ker Sangari - Kere Sangari, a famous dish in Rajasthan, served hot with baajre ki roti and topped with melting Makkhan (white butter).

‚Ä¢ Bajra Ki Raab - Bajra Ki Raab is a healthy soup made of bajra flour, dry ginger powder, jaggery, ajwain, and desi ghee. Having a rich taste, this soup keeps the body warm and active during winter.

‚Ä¢ Ghevar - Ghevar is prepared in desi ghee, and it's a tremendously beloved dessert. It is traditionally served at weddings, festivals, and similar celebrations.

4. Famous Places In Rajasthan To Visit

Spend some time in each of these magical cities, with all their exemplary attractions, important experiences, exquisite food, exclusive handicrafts, and an exploration of the life of its people. While we have a list of the most attractive cities in Rajasthan herein, be sure to visit them on your Rajasthan holiday trip.

1. Jaipur

Pink City, is famous for its royal palaces and popular markets within its Old City. Tourists may enjoy spectacular views of the city from Nahargarh Fort, take elephant rides at Amer Fort, and taste the traditional cuisine at Chokhi Dhani.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Shopping Markets, Forts, Heritage

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: City Palace, Hawa Mahal, Amer Fort, Amber Palace, Nahargarh Fort

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Bus, Train, Taxi

2. Jaisalmer

Jaisalmer, the Golden City, is renowned for its sandstone Havelis. Tourists can plan their vacations and activities that include camel safari in Sam Sand Dunes, camping in the Gadisar Lake, and boating leisure. You can explore the town with Rajasthan tour packages.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Forts, Desert Safari, Havelis, Culture

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Jaisalmer Fort, Jain Temples, Desert National Park, Kuldhara Village

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Bus, Train, Taxi

3. Udaipur

Udaipur is renowned for its scenic natural beauty and the rich history of the Mewar Kingdom. Boating in Lake Pichola, a morning walk along Fatehsagar Lake, an exciting drive to Monsoon Palace, and shopping in Hathipole are among the highlights of Udaipur.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Handicrafts, Heritage, Palaces, Lakes

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: City Palace, Lake Pichola, Jagmandir, Lake Palace

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Bus, Train, Taxi

4. Pushkar

Pushkar in the region of Ajmer is a standout nationally famous religious spot in India. Don't miss the opportunity to visit this place with our Rajasthan holiday tour packages. Explore and soak in its sacred ghats for the ultimate calming experience.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Temples, Ghats

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Pushkar Lake, Rangji Temple, Savitri Mata Temple, Brahmaji Temple

‚Ä¢ ransportation Options: Bus, Train, Taxi

5. Jodhpur

Our all-inclusive Rajasthan tour packages will allow you to have an experience as you tour Mewar's new capital, nicknamed Jodhpur. Known as the Sun City, this location of western Rajasthan is surrounded by a walled town, palaces, and magnificent hill forts.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Blue Houses, Ghats, Temples

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Umaid Bhawan Palace, Jaswant Thada, Mehrangarh Fort

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Bus, Train, Taxi

6. Mount Abu

Located in the Aravalli Mountains, Mount Abu has gorgeous Jain temples that draw travelers from around the world. Surrounded by lush forests and lakes, rivers, and waterfalls. If you long to experience the vacation experience of the homes of hill stations in Rajasthan, check out our Rajasthan tour packages

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Temples, Aravalli Mountain Range

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Nakki Lake, Sunset Point, Dilwara Temples, Mount Abu Wildlife Sanctuary

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Bus, Train, Taxi

7. Ranthambore

Ranthambore is an ideal place for visitors who love animals, photography, and lush tropical flora. Towering tigers, national parks, and remaining forests are just some of the things that make Ranthambore a fantastic destination.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Wildlife, Forts

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Ranthambore Fort, Surwal Lake, Ranthambore Tiger Reserve, Kachida Valley

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Bus, Train, Taxi

8. Bikaner

The town that is most culturally rich in the state of Rajasthan is Bikaner. It has some of the best cuisines in the state, with its famous snacks and heritage locations. Don‚Äôt miss this place to explore while you‚Äôre on a Rajasthan holiday trip.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Forts, Palaces

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Laxmi Niwas Palace, Junagarh Fort, Lalgarh Palace, Wildlife Sanctuary

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Bus, Train, Taxi

9. Sariska

Sariska is more than just famous for its animal and plant diversity. Take advantage of the opportunity and make sure to spend plenty of time in the area while you are here. Check out our best Rajasthan tour packages.

‚Ä¢ Major Attraction: Mananchira, Kozhikode Beach, Kadalundi Bird Sanctuary

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Wildlife, Dry Deciduous forest

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Sariska National Tiger Reserve, Bhangarh Fort, Siliserh Lake

5. Best Things To Do On Rajasthan Holiday Trip

Location: Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary, Sariska Tiger Reserve, Keoladeo National Park, Ranthambore National Park.

Uttarakhand Tour Package

Uttarakhand has remarkable tourist locations and activities, with options for travelers of all types and budgets. The countless tour packages, prices, and ticket options for various areas, resorts, and cities make Uttarakhand one of the world's top vacation destinations.
longpackagedesc:
1. Best Time To Visit Uttarakhand

Although Uttarakhand welcomes tourists any time of year, soaking up the region's lush and beautiful environs is the ideal time to do so during the summer. When the heat of the cities of India becomes unbearable, Uttarakhand's snow-covered mountains can provide a much-needed respite from the heat.

For those seeking an exciting interest in a vibrant atmosphere, winter is the best season to visit this location with our Uttarakhand tour packages. But, you should only come to this location during the off-season, since rainy weather often leads to landslides, traffic jams, and delays.

Below, you'll see what is the best time to see the beautiful scenery of Uttarakhand. You can explore our affordable Uttarakhand tour packages from Delhi for your next trip to Uttarakhand.

Summer Season (March - June)

March to June signals that it is time to expel winter and get nearer to summer. As the temperature rises from 20 degrees Celsius to 35 degrees Celsius, the setting is enlivened by the presence of nature and is fun to explore for trekking and other physical activities.

Monsoon Season (July - September)

With the weather hovering between 15 degrees Celsius and 25 degrees Celsius, the months of July to September bring heavy rainfalls in Uttarakhand. As the transport disruptions brought on by landslides and road closures may limit your trips, it's not advised to visit Uttarakhand during the monsoon season.

Winter Season (October - February)

You can find the wintertime in Uttarakhand from October to February. The climate is tremendously cold during this time. No matter what sort of winter vacation you're thinking about.

2. How to Reach Uttarakhand?

For traveling within the state of Uttarakhand, there are several available options. Individuals can travel by train, bus, or taxi; and if they're looking to go from one region to another, another option is to charter a taxi, ride on a cycle rickshaw, take an auto-rickshaw, or book a bus package. Exist nationwide tour packages to Uttarakhand.

By Air

Uttarakhand is easy to access from high-rises in many other cities across India. Both of these airports typically offer only a few flights at certain times of the day, so it is important to do your research to make sure that it is a good option for you.

By Train

It is incredibly easy to reach Uttarakhand by train from anywhere in the world. There are Express and other public transportation routes that can depart from Delhi, Lucknow, Varanasi, Kolkata, and other major cities.

By Road

Traveling by road is one of the chief choices when planning to visit Uttarakhand since an extensive road network covers the entire territory. From Delhi and other neighboring states.

3. Famous Dishes Of Uttarakhand

Uttarakhand Cuisine offers you a tantalizing mixture of spicy tastes with a delicate aroma in their famous hill stations, such as Panch Phoron and Khas-Khas spices. During your trip to Uttarakhand hill stations, you could be fortunate enough to enjoy the aroma of Panch Phoron, curry spices that will forever and truly reside in your taste buds.

‚Ä¢ Kafuli - Popular dish of Kafuli, which combines several green leafy vegetables. It is a mixture of various green vegetables that is a nutritional powerhouse.

‚Ä¢ Phaanu - A popular dish of Uttarakhand, Phaanu is a blend of various legumes. Served with rice which is sure to make an impression on your taste buds.

‚Ä¢ Baadi - It is a mixture of taste and nutrition, and it is perceived as one of the best local foods of the Garhwal region in Uttarakhand.

‚Ä¢ Aaloo Tamatar Ka Jhol - Aaloo Tamatar Ka Jhol is one of the clear sensations from the menu of Uttrakhand's well-liked cuisine. A spicy, aromatic blend of indescribable taste and fast preparation, this dish is one of the specialties that stand out among the region's cuisines..

‚Ä¢ Chainsoo - This dish contains a great deal of protein and essential nutrients. The Chainsoo dining experience is slow to gratify but happily worth trying!

‚Ä¢ Dubuk - Made from Arhar Ki Dal that's been slowly cooked in a kadhai and served. It truly is outstanding, especially during the winter.

‚Ä¢ Jhangora Ki Kheer - Millet is a distinctive main ingredient of the state's famous recipe, its richness in texture and nutrition is due in part to milk.

‚Ä¢ Garhwal Ka Fannah - This dish is known as a staple of Mussoorie cuisine. The delicacy is not only nourishing but also pleasing to look at.

‚Ä¢ Gulgula - Gulgula is a snack or dessert comprised of jaggery. This sweet is widely known in North India.

‚Ä¢ Singori - This is a sweet dish in Uttarakhand made with Khoa. This particular dish is wrapped in the Maalu leaf and served as an appetizer in the Kumaon areas.

4. Famous Places To Visit In Uttarakhand

Uttarakhand is the perfect place for any adventurous individual looking to cross the mountains of the Himalayas, daring enough to ski on the snow, and willing to adventure into her own self. Our Uttarakhand tour packages from Delhi are designed with adventure-seekers in mind, which provide guests an excellent excuse to visit.

1. Mussorie

The queen of hill stations, Mussoorie has located a short distance from Dehradun. Offering a breathtaking view of the Shivalik hills, the town is renowned for shopping, temples, and bookstores. You will always find a place for Mussoorie in our Uttarakhand holiday tour packages itineraries.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Mystic hills, beautiful waterbody

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Mall road, Laal Tibba Scenic Point

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

2. Nainital

Nestled between the emerald green Naini Lake and the Mall Road of the Kumaon region of Uttarakhand, this hill station is renowned for its perfect attractions, boating facilities, a stunning zoo, and Raj Bhawan. Sari River and the Naini Lake Valley lack the village's villages.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Naini Lake, Hanuman Garhi, Tibetan Market

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Kamaltal, Bhimtal

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

3. Rishikesh

Rishikesh is known for its spiritual aura as well as its adventures. Thousands and thousands of people flock to Rishikesh each year because of their search for spiritual awareness, and to enjoy adventurous activities.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Triveni Ghat, Temples

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Laxman Jhula, Parmarth Niketan Ashram, Ram Jhula

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

4. Jim Corbett National Park

Oldest national park in India, and it is home to enormous animals like elephants, tigers, deer, and so on. Situated in the foothills of the Himalayas, this national park is open all year round, with the exception of the monsoon season. A jeep safari allows you to get up close with the animals that are wild there.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Jeep Safari, Wildlife

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Corbett Meusum, Girija Devi Temple

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

5. Auli

Auli is a great place for people who are seeking peace, adventure, and tranquility. Auli has the best skiing available in the country, where you are exquisitely impressed by the white snow and magnificent views of Himalayan peaks from the top.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Adventurous activities, Kuari Pass Trek

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Trishul Peak, Chenab Lake, Rudraprayag, Artificial Lake

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

6. Landour

Landour, situate not far from Mussoorie, is a place to go for those who are looking to retire in a wonderful location. People come to Landour to spend time in nature to relax and enjoy themselves. So grab the best from our Uttarakhand package and enjoy yourself in this place for a short while.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Architecture, High Altitude Points

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Robber‚Äôs cave, Nag Tibba

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

7. Almora

Almora is one of the most stunning hill stations in Uttarakhand that has restored its natural charm and serenity. The place is perfect for all nature lovers, adventure freaks, and couples. The marvelous views of the valleys and mountains along with the quietness offered by nature.

‚Ä¢ Must Do Activities: Trekking, visiting the mini zoo, etc

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Waterfalls, Adventures, Fauna

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, car-rentals, taxi

8. Kovalam

Settled along the Arabian sea coastlines, favored with magnificent sea shores and beautiful scenes, this ocean-side town found only 16 km from Thiruvananthapuram is, without a doubt, Kovalam one of the most pursued travel locations. One can book the best travel packages for Uttarakhand and get to explore captivating attractions.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Wildlife Sanctuaries, Temples,

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Chitai Golu Devta Temple, Kasar Devi Temple

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

9. Chopta

Chopta is a scenic and peaceful subtropical hill station found in Uttarakhand that is located away from any crowds. Adventurers and nature lovers preferred to visit Chopta much more, that‚Äôs why it is the main hub for treks in the region.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Temples

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Chandrashila trek, Tungnath

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Buses

10. Haridwar

Haridwar is a holy place where numerous temples of different cultures stand. If you're in a bad mood, these temples are sure to provide a lot of energy and help bring you back again. You'll love the evening aarti at the Ganges River.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Temples, Ghats, Holy Baths

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Ganga Ghat, Har ki Pauri, Temples

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

11. Ranikhet

The natural beauty and lush forests of Ranikhet will leave you wanting to capture every scene with your camera. This peaceful hill station is tranquil and quiet, posing an array of scenic offers. You can explore this place well with our Uttarakhand holiday tour packages from India.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Lush Green Hills, Temples

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Jhula Devi Temple, Bhalu Dam, Chaubatia Gardens

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

5. Adventurous Activities To Do In Uttrakhand

‚Ä¢ Trekking ‚Äì Trekking in the Indian Himalayas is also popular among thrill-seekers for its sake as well as the amount of work it takes.

‚Ä¢ Paragliding ‚Äì The rush of flying and panoramic view with mountains surroundings mountainscape as adrenaline surges as you paraglide in Uttarakhand.

‚Ä¢ Ziplining ‚Äì Zip-line activity is yet another family-friendly experience that is very popular in Uttrakhand.

‚Ä¢ Cable Car Ride ‚Äì A ride in a cable car is one that you will surely enjoy. You will be able to observe a lot of the surroundings while on the cable car

‚Ä¢ Elephant Safaris ‚Äì One can choose the thrill of riding the rides at either Corbett National Park or Rajaji National Park.

‚Ä¢ Camping ‚Äì It gives you a chance to value the awe-inspiring force of nature. Seeing and loving the beauty of nature is Uttarakhand's specialty.

‚Ä¢ Skiing ‚Äì The snow-covered hills of Auli provide the perfect location to delight in skiing.

‚Ä¢ White Water Rafting ‚Äì The sport is created on the highest fast-pulling rapids of the Ganges and Tons rivers in the state of Uttarakhand.

shortpackagedesc:
Goa Tour Package

When it comes to Goa, there is a whole lot you can do with our Goa tour packages. You may be a party person, or you want some respite from your routine everyday life, Goa will lead you through it all.
longpackagedesc:
1. Best Time To Visit Goa

Though the best time of year to go to Goa is not restricted to any particular time of the year, the climate in Goa is most pleasant from October to March, and the December season is liked by vacationers who want to take part in lit parties and electric festivals in Goa. If you are planning a Goa trip anytime soon, then must explore our Goa tour packages for the best deals.

Summer Season

Mornings and evenings are excellent throughout the summer, but the afternoon can become unbearable with temperatures often greater than 40 degrees Celsius. Explore our affordable Goa tour packages from Delhi in the summertime with us, if you are looking for a budget-friendly Goa trip. Book your Goa tour packages with special deals.

Monsoon Season

This season brings life back to leaves that have wilted in dry weather and make the surrounding area greener and more beautiful. The Dudhsagar waterfall also provides a stunning view for travelers. If you're a nature enthusiast, visiting Goa with our best Goa tour packages at this time is a great choice.

Due to the lovely weather, this is also a great time to book a Goa honeymoon package.

Winter Season

Couples and tourists interested in seeing everything the location has to offer often flock to Goa in Northern India at this time. Goa is full of nightlife, and visitors can celebrate Christmas and New Year. Also, there were numerous festivals being held at that time. Explore our best Goa tour packages for the best Goa trip ever.

2. How To Reach Goa?

Between Karnataka and Maharashtra, Goa is easily accessible by a number of modes of transportation. Check out the detailed information concerning transportation to Goa, including the prices of various Goa tour packages.

By Air

Goa International Airport (Dabolim Airport), is just 29 km away from Panaji. You may also book a taxi at this location to travel to your destination or hotel from here. Explore Goa tour packages with flights on our website.

By Train

Some of the major train stations in Goa are Madgaon and zVasco-da-Gama stations. Goa has expanded its transport network to make traveling more comfortable, which is why more stations have been made available like Karmali, Pernem, and Sanverdam Church. To access your hotel, you can find a taxi from here.

3. Famous Dishes To Try In Goa

Goa dishes have a high array of herbs and spices. You're going to see the local cuisine influenced by Goa which is also located on the West Coast and Arabian Sea of the subcontinent. Seafood predominates over spices and flavors.

‚Ä¢ Fish Recheado - Pomfret is infused with a homemade relish, fried with onions, and fried to a golden brown. It's absolutely everything that you could have ever dreamed of.

‚Ä¢ Bebinca - Bebinca, a classic dessert from the Goa region, is prepared with coconut milk, butter, eggs, and jaggery, usually having about seven to 16 layers. Every bite of this dessert makes the following one all the more delicious.

‚Ä¢ Pork Vindaloo - Meat lovers get extremely excited about pork vindaloo. The dish involves garlic, ginger, cumin, and minced pork cooked in vinegar and ginger sauce till it's tender.

‚Ä¢ Chicken Xacuti - If you love juicy chunks of spice-infused chicken pieces, dish chicken xacutiac is the way to go. While it's genuinely a tasty dinner option, you could also enjoy it with oatmeal and rice.

‚Ä¢ Goan Fish Curry - You won't leave Goa without sampling the famous Goan fish curry. Goan fish curry is typically seasoned with herbs and lemon juice and fried.

‚Ä¢ Goan Prawn Curry - If you like prawns, you will never taste anything better. Juicy prawns are cooked in coconut milk Goan curry and let the magic of Goan food take over.

‚Ä¢ Shark Ambot Tik - Ambot Tik is a Portuguese-influenced Goan food. Red chilies contribute to the dish's spiciness, and the kokum mellows out the stew's acid content. Shark fish is cooked with onions, tomatoes, and saffron.

‚Ä¢ Goan Nevri - Also known as karanji, these sweet balls are simple dough balls that are stuffed with coconut, almonds, sugar, and cardamom. This sweet dish is made mostly during Ganesh Chaturthi and Diwali festivals.

4. Famous Places To Visit In Goa

1. Old Goa

Located in Goa, India, in 1986, the city is the site of a group of Portuguese churches and convents built mainly in the 16th and 17th centuries. The ornate chapels and tall towers are the principal attractions there, which were founded as a place of trade on the banks of the Mandovi River. This place has to be in your itinerary of Goa tour packages.

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Basilica of Bom Jesus, Archaeological Museum, Museum of Christian Art,

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Buses, Cabs, Rented cars

2. Chopara Fort

Overlooking the Chapora River in the town of Bardez, Chopara Fort is one of the major bastions in Goa. It offers an advantageous view of the Indian Ocean and nearby Vagator Beach, known for its nightlife.

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Chapora Beach, Vagator Beach, Siddeshwar Temple

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Buses, Cabs, Rented cars

3. Aguada Fort

It is well known for its remarkable architecture, scenic views, and rich history. Formerly, it was also employed as a jail and as a warehouse for water because there are 2,376,000 gallons of water available here.

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Old Lighthouse Tower, Lower Aguada Fort, Aguda Rocky Beach

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Buses, Cabs, Rented cars

4. Sri Mahadeva Temple

The temple is adorned with fantastic stone carvings. It is one of the oldest temples in Goa. It is one of the best places to visit in Goa if you wonder about offbeat destinations. The architectural style of the temple also results in guests flocking to this site.

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Rock Cut Caves of Arvalem, Maruti Temple, Ravindra Theatre

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Buses, Cabs, Rented cars

5. Butterfly Conservatory Of Goa

Situated in Ponda, the Butterfly Conservatory is home to various butterfly species. This spot's population is designed as a sanctuary, meaning you can enjoy the butterflies through a leisurely walk. "The Butterfly Pub" occupies 4000 sq. m.

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Sada WaterFalls, St Anne's Church, Pascoal Spice Village

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Buses, Cabs, Rented cars

6. Anjuna Flea Market

Anyone who loves collecting souvenirs may want to see Anjuna, Flea Market. Goa tour packages are available in which you can go to this market. It's the best place to purchase trinkets, souvenirs, clothes and accessories, hats, handicrafts, art pieces, footwear, etc. Therefore, you should definitely visit this market.

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Anjuna Beach, Calangute Bazaar

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Buses, Cabs, Rented cars

7. Se Cathedral

The church is the home of the Golden Bell, a world-famous bell known for its reverberating sound. When you get to the church now, you will see how magnificent engineering and architectural design were used while developing it. Include this place in your Goa tour packages.

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Basilica of Bom Jesus, Church & Monastery of St Augustine, The Archeological Museum

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, car-rentals, taxi

8. Dudhsagar Falls

Nestled in the lush evergreen Western Ghats, this stunning waterfall is a must-visit place. From solo travelers to honeymooners, be sure to catch its full glory in the rainy season. The falls are the tallest in the country, dropping 1017 feet.

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Bhagwan Mahavir Wildlife Sanctuary, Tambdi Surla Mahadev Temple

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Buses, Cabs, Rented cars

5. Islands In Goa

‚Ä¢ Chorao Island

A beautiful place to go seek inner peace is Chorao island. 5 kilometres away from Panjim, you can easily take a ferry to Chorao. If you're looking for a beautiful getaway experience on an island surrounded by mangroves, then exploring Chorao should top your list. The best way to conduct such an adventure is accompanied by a paddle boat as it is easy and fun to ride.

‚Ä¢ Butterfly Islan

The name of the island is Butterfly Island because of its shape. When seen by a boat, it looks exactly like a butterfly, fully ready to fly. The guests on the island feel the same desire of flying like butterflies. The island is also commonly referred to as Honeymoon Island.

‚Ä¢ Divar Island

Located 10 km from Panjim, Divar Island was once a thriving town populated by Hindus. Visitors can enjoy ferries throughout the day. There are three villages on the island, including Piedade and Malar. The two famous annual events of Bonderam and Potekar are similar to Halloween.

‚Ä¢ Sao Jacinto Island

It is the most beautiful creation designed by nature. The name of this island is derived from the name of St. Jacinto Catholic Church. While located in South Goa, it attracts a lot of tourists. An attraction for the lover of nature and photography churn. Explore this place with our Goa tour packages.

‚Ä¢ Conco Island or Monkey Island

Conco Island is yet another astonishing island that primarily draws in foreign guests. Located in Canacona, at the bay of Palolem Beach, it's also known as Monkey Island. Boats are available from the popular Palolem beach at this location to rent to ease your way up there to Conco island.

Our Goa Tour Packages to the "Party Capital of India," include a tour itinerary that guarantees travelers enjoy a planned, organized, and hassle-free vacation. These customized tour packages are specially tailored to meet all major demands of travelers.

At one of the many tourist destinations popular with vacationers, solo travelers, families with kids, and honeymooners, Goa has recently been attracting more visitors than ever.

shortpackagedesc:
Kashmir Tour Package

Our Kashmir tour packages let you explore this paradise which is nestled between snow-capped mountain tops and lush green valleys, Kashmir lies in the northern head of India.
longpackagedesc:
Best Time To Visit Kashmir

Kashmir is, hands down, a year-round destination. Visit the lovely place and book your Kashmir tour packages in advance. In all seasons, irrespective of summer or winter Kashmir is a popular destination for travellers from all over India and around the globe. So, irrespective of what time it is, pack your bags & plan your Kashmir trip with our best tour packages for Kashmir. If you are looking to plan a honeymoon then you can explore our Kashmir tour package for couple.

Summer Season

The gorgeous blooming Kashmiri gardens sprint with colors during the summer in Kashmir, so it is an excellent time to go. However, Jammu also becomes a much busy location during this time; therefore, if it's possible, it's generally best to avoid it.

Monsoon Season

A lot of people seek to keep away from visiting Kashmir during monsoons, as rainfall can sometimes become an issue when planning sightseeing tours. If you heed the weather forecasts, though, you won't have to fear the rain impacting your travel plans.

Winter Season

December and January may be cold for non-locals, but locals in Kashmir enjoy ideal weather conditions all of December. The Pir-Panjal mountain range is also completely covered by snow, with spectacular scenery. December and early January have superb weather for sports and skiing as well.

Autumn Season

In autumn, places like Srinagar and nearby Dachigam transform into gorgeous sights as trees change colour. The weather is warm enough but not excessively cool, so it's an exciting season in which to plan a Kashmir vacation. Apple picking and harvesting also take place around this time. Kashmir is at its best during autumn because of the lovely foliage.

How To Reach Kashmir?

The state is accessible primarily through road, rail, and flight. Jammu Tawi is the nearest railway station for Kashmir, whereas Jammu Airport is 48 km from Katra and Srinagar International Airport is 24 km away from Srinagar city.

Travellers who have any questions can always turn to the travel guide that we provide as a component of the Kashmir holiday packages. If you are looking for affordable options to visit Kashmir then you must check out our cheapest tour packages for Kashmir.

How to Plan Your Kashmir Tour By Air

If you want to access Kashmir by air, the best option is to fly to Srinagar Airport, which is located around 15 kilometres from the city. Srinagar Airport is accessible with our Kashmir tour packages from Delhi, Goa, Bangalore, Mumbai, Leh, and many other urban cities. Explore our Kashmir tour packages with flights for the best deals.

How to Plan Your Kashmir Tour By Road

Kashmir has an excellent network of roads and is very well connected to the major cities of Jammu and Kashmir. The state also has proper commutation of private and public buses which cover small villages and towns. There are many direct buses to Kashmir from Delhi and Chandigarh. Kashmir is connected to Jammu via Road 1-A National Highway. You can simply check out our Jammu Kashmir tour package and plan accordingly.

How to Plan Your Kashmir Tour By Train

The closest railway station to the Jammu Tawi Railway Station is of Jammu Tawi Railway System, which is approximately 330 kilometres away. The most popular trains, such as Delhi-Jammu Tawi-Rajdhani Express, Jammu Tawi Express, and Jammu Mail, arrive at this station from Delhi.

Famous Dishes To Try In Kashmir

Kashmir is heaven for people who enjoy a trip to beautiful spots and delicious foods too. It's worth making a visit to Kashmir, and when you do so, your taste buds will long take pleasure in the taste of Kashmir Food. Browsing through the list will provide you with will leave you drooling.

‚Ä¢ Rogan Josh - Rogan Josh is a rich spiced lamb curry cooked with fried onions, turmeric, ginger, and other spices. It's best served with naan or rice.

   Where To Taste - Lhasa Garden Restaurant, Sunset Boulevard

‚Ä¢ Modur Pulao - It is prepared in the goodness of milk, saffron, ghee, and cinnamon. That‚Äôs not it! The rice is then garnished with a whole lot of dry fruits.

   Where To Taste - Ahdoos, Pahalgam Hotel

‚Ä¢ Dum Olav - If you want to consume scrumptious Kashmiri food, it is recommended to take a trip with our Kashmir tour packages and experience the Dum Aloo Kashmir eating its style. Have it with fresh bread or roti.

   Where To Taste - Shamyana Restaurant, Krishna Vaishno Dhaba

‚Ä¢ Yakhni Lamb Curry - A number of Kashmir cuisine is yogurt-based, and Yakhni Lamb Curry is no exception. The lamb is cooked in a thick curry made from yogurt, mawal blossoms, onion paste, and dry mint leaves.

   Where To Taste - Shamyana Restaurant, Lhasa Restaurant

‚Ä¢ Goshtaba - Goshtaba is a traditional delicacy that comes from the dish for kings and has a thrilling taste. It is basically minced mutton balls prepared in a yogurt sauce and the gravity of various spices.

   Where To Taste - Kashmiri Kitchen, Matamaal

‚Ä¢ Kahva - This food is widely consumed by Kashmiris at their festivals and feasts. Kahva is a herbal green tea brewed with saffron, almonds, and walnuts.

   Where To Taste - Chaai Jaai, Stream Restaurant

‚Ä¢ Shab Deg - It is a tasty Kashmiri cuisine, that leaves a primal sense of nostalgia in those who hear its simple name. Any Kashmiris reading this will comprehend. Shab Deg is a famous meat dish grilled all night by expert chefs with great skill.

   Where To Taste - Kashmiri Kitchen, Lhasa Restaurant

‚Ä¢ Aab Gosh - It is one of the favorite dishes of the local cuisine and culture. It is prepared from mutton that is cooked and soaked in vegetable oil and spices. After this, you will never want to eat other mutton dishes.

   Where To Taste - Mughal Darbar, Shamyana Restaurant

‚Ä¢ Kashmiri Muji Gaad - This dish is served during special events and festivities in the Kashmiri province in December. It is composed of both vegetarian and non-vegetarian ingredients, giving it a complex taste thanks to its warm spices and herbs.

   Where To Taste - Bon Appetit, Shamyana Restaurant

Famous Places To Visit In Kashmir

1. Srinagar

Srinagar is the most visited tourist spot. Here, people can enjoy the shikhara rides and overnight stays in the houseboats at Dal Lake and view the magnificent Grand Mughal Gardens by the lake. Srinagar is featured in all our Kashmir tour packages.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Valleys, Waterfronts, Lush Green Environment

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Betaab Valley, Aru Valley, Mughal Gardens, Wular Lake, Dachigam National Park

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, Taxi, Private cabs

2. Gulmarg

Our Kashmir tour packages include Gulmarg, one of the most stunning cities not only in Kashmir but in India as a whole. The beauty of Gulmarg is comparable to a beautiful landscape covered in greenery and snow-capped mountain ranges in the background.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Skiing, Lakes, Temples, Snow-capped peaks,

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Strawberry Field, Gulmarg Biosphere Reserve, Seven Springs

‚Ä¢Transportation: Bus, Taxi, Private cabs

3. Pahalgam

Pahalgam is known for its peacefulness and mesmerizing vistas. The best attractions here are Betab and Aru Valley. Horseback riding and canoeing are the ideal adventures to test in Pahalgam. It's a popular attraction that draws the best of Kashmir tour packages.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Temples, Valleys

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Lidder Valley, Aru Valley, Betaab Valley, Mamleshwar Temple, Lolab Valley

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, Taxi, Private cabs

4. Sonmarg

Another place where tourists may enjoy the vacation packages for Kashmir is Sonamarg. This beautiful area has green meadows and breathtaking views and is perfect for trekking or camping. The nature trail, trekking, and camping trips can best be enjoyed there.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Camping, Silk Road, Glaciers

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Zoji La Pass, Vishansar Lake, Nilagrad River, Baltal Valley

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, Taxi, Private cabs

5. Kupwara

Kupwara is situated 90 kilometers from Srinagar. Beautiful landscapes are visible all-around, with stunning mountains and fresh lakes. Book Kashmir tour packages with a flight and enjoy the great mountain views in Kupwara.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Breathtaking sceneries, Wildlife,

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Lolab Valley, Bangus Valley, Sattbarran Kalaroos, Seemab Valley

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, Taxi, Private cabs

6. Kathua

Kathua is often called the city of Sufis because there are many shrines in that region. The area borders Jammu and Kashmir, Punjab, and Himachal Pradesh, so it's a major industrial hub in the greater area. Explore the attractive shrines on Kashmir tour packages.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Ancient Temples, Historical Monuments

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Chandel, Bani, Panyalag, Sarthal, Duggan, Bansal

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, Taxi, Private cabs

7. Katra

Katra is situated on the banks of Trikuta ranges. The holy town of Katra located on the region's hills is notable for its Vaishno Devi temple, which sits at a high altitude. The Vaishno Devi temple is one of Katra's most famous landmarks.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Vaishno Devi Temple

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Bhairon Temple, Sanjichhat, Himkoti, Darshani Darwaza

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, Taxi, Private cabs

8. Jammu

Jammu is also famous for its religious shrines dating all the way back to historical times. This place is renowned for its rivers, including the Tawi, Ravi, and Chenab. Jammu is one of the most popular travel destinations with Kashmir tour packages.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Temples, Shawls, Walnut woodwork

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Vaishno Devi Temple, Raghunath Temple, Bahu Fort, Bhimgarh Fort

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, Taxi, Private cabs

9. Patnitop

Patnitop is a great place to view the snow-covered Himalayas. Try outdoor sports such as skiing, paragliding, and trekking or a laid-back excursion away from a city. It is also a source of serenity, making it a good place to recharge when you want a break from the hustle-bustle of urban life.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Adventure Sports, Skiing, Temples

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Nathatop, Naag Mandir, Kud Park, Madhatop, Sudh Mahadev Temple

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, Taxi, Private cabs

Adventure Activities In Kashmir

‚Ä¢ Trekking amid the rough trails

   Location: Kashmir Alpine Lakes Trek

‚Ä¢ White water rafting through gushing lakes

   Location: Lidder river, Pahalgam

‚Ä¢ Mountain skiing amid snow-capped peaks

   Location: Gulmarg, Kashmir

‚Ä¢ Camping in nature's paradise

   Location: Sonmarg, Pahalgam

‚Ä¢ Golfing amid verdant valleys of Kashmir

   Location: Gulmarg, Kashmir

‚Ä¢ Shikara ride, a worthful pleasure

   Location: Dal lake, Srinagar

shortpackagedesc:
Manali Tour Package

Manali is a popular choice for both leisure and adventure seekers alike. Tripzygo offers cost-effective and budget-friendly Manali holiday tour packages that are worth considering if you are looking to have a peaceful getaway or an adventurous escape.
longpackagedesc:
1. Best Time To Explore Manali Tour Packages

November and February are the ideal months to witness the scenic beauty of Manali. You can travel there in winter and experience the picturesque landscape covered with a thick sheet of snow. As the festive season approaches, December is an ideal time for a honeymoon in Manali. It's a great month to make memories and spend quality time with our Manali tour package for couple.

Summer Season

Summer season is the ideal time for outdoor adventure activities in Solang Valley. With its pleasant weather, you can enjoy paragliding, rafting, and trekking in this beautiful destination.

No matter which time of year you book Manali trip packages and take a trip, it is always advisable to take into account the current weather conditions. This will help ensure that your holiday is safe and enjoyable.

Monsoon Season

Manali experiences its monsoon season from July through to mid-September. It is best to avoid traveling to Manali during the monsoon season as the city receives quite a bit of rainfall then. But, if you still want to try, check out our best packages for Manali.

Winter Season

Planning a Manali trip in the winter season? October to February is considered one of the best times for a visit here due to favorable climate conditions.

Winter sports such as skiing and snow scooter are perfect for this season, especially due to the snowfall. So make sure to partake in them and have fun with our holiday packages to Manali.

2. How To Reach Manali?

If you plan to travel to Manali and about to book your Manali holiday tour packages here are the various available transportation options you can choose a bus, train, air, or car.

By Air

Kullu-Manali Airport (KUU) in Bhuntar is the closest domestic airport to Manali. The airport offers regular flights to Delhi and Chandigarh, from where you can book a taxi or cab. Check our Manali Shimla package with flights for better options.

For those visiting Manali from other countries, the closest international airport is the Indira Gandhi International Airport (DEL) located in Delhi.

By Train

The closest railway station to Manali is Joginder Nagar, located 162.6 km away. If you want to get to Manali by train, you need to disembark at Joginder Nagar Railway Station.

An alternative option is to take a train to Chandigarh Railway Station and then hire a cab or board a bus from there that can help you reach your destination.

3. Famous Dishes To Try In Manali

Manali is renowned for its amazing and yummy dishes. Visitors from all over the world come to try them out. When you take Manali trip, you should savor these amazing dishes.

It's time to get a taste of these delicious dishes!

‚Ä¢ Khatta - This pumpkin dish is prepared with traditional methods and has a delicious sweet and sour flavor. It goes perfectly when served with rice.

‚Ä¢ Babru - Babru is deep-fried and served with tamarind chutney for a burst of extra taste. Experience the delightful tastes of Himachal Pradesh's cuisine with every single bite.

‚Ä¢ Aktori - Aktori is a delicious cake commonly prepared at festivities in Manali. You can enhance its flavours with a topping of honey and truly savour the taste of Pahari cuisine.

‚Ä¢ Chana Madra - Chana Madra is a slow-cooked dish made with chickpeas and yogurt gravy. To truly savor this Pahari dish, it should be enjoyed with warm & fluffy rice.

‚Ä¢ Tudkiya Bhath - This dish prepared with rice, lentils, and some unique spices blended together to give it that classic Pahari flavor. Its every bite will tantalize your taste buds with a variety of flavors.

‚Ä¢ Bhey - Bhey is a beloved specialty dish made with lotus stems as the main ingredient & also known as spicy lotus stem. This dish has a delightful golden-brown crunchiness to it.

‚Ä¢ Mitha - Mitha is a sweet dish prepared with sweetened rice and raisins and with dry fruits. This is a sweet saffron rice dish with the authentic flavors of Pahari cuisine.

‚Ä¢ Siddu - One of the most beloved local dishes. Non-vegetarians simply can't resist the mouthwatering taste of mutton stuffing encased in dough, then steamed to perfection.

4. Famous Places To Visit With Manali Tour Packages

Manali is one of the best holiday destinations in India and has something for everyone - solo travelers, families, and even if you are looking for honeymoon in Manali. maintitle: Jaipur Tour Packages - Book Now at 25% Off
description: Jaipur tour packages - Our Jaipur holiday packages let you experience the majestic monuments, vibrant culture, and delicious cuisine of this beautiful city.
keywords: jaipur tour packages, jaipur trip package, jaipur tour package from delhi, jaipur city tour package, jaipur travel package, jaipur holiday packages, jaipur vacation packages, cheap jaipur packages
shortpackagedesc:
Jaipur Tour Package

Jaipur, also known as the Pink City, is a vibrant and culturally rich city in the state of Rajasthan, India. There are many reasons why our Jaipur tour packages make your vacation the best, including its stunning itinerary, activities, and sightseeing.
longpackagedesc:
1. Best Time To Visit Jaipur

The best time to visit Jaipur is between October and March when the weather is relatively mild and pleasant. During this time, the average temperature ranges from 15¬∞C to 25¬∞C, making it comfortable to explore the city's outdoor attractions. This is also the peak tourist season in Jaipur, so you can expect higher prices for accommodation and other services. We recommend you to go with our Jaipur city tour package for affordable options.

Summer Season

The summer months from April to June are very hot in Jaipur, with temperatures often exceeding 40¬∞C. It can be challenging to enjoy outdoor activities during this time due to the heat, and many tourists avoid visiting Jaipur during these months.

Monsoon Season

The monsoon season from July to September can also be a good time to visit Jaipur, as the city receives moderate rainfall during this time, and the weather cools down a bit. However, it is essential to be prepared for sudden showers and occasional flooding in some areas. Get your customized Jaipur travel package where you can include & exclude anything according to you.

Winter Season

Winter in Jaipur typically lasts from November to February, and it is the best time to visit the city with our Jaipur vacation packages. During these months, the weather is pleasant, and the average temperature ranges from 15¬∞C to 25¬∞C, making it ideal for sightseeing and outdoor activities

2. How To Reach Jaipur?

Jaipur is well-connected to major cities in India by air, road, and rail. You can choose options according to your convenience. We recommend you to check our Jaipur tour packages with flights or with trains, it‚Äôs totally up to you. Get your packages customized with best assistance with us.

By Air

The Jaipur International Airport, located about 13 km from the city center, is well-connected to major cities in India and abroad. Many airlines operate regular flights to and from Jaipur, making it easy for tourists to reach the city by air. Must check out our Jaipur trip package with flights for the best options.

By Train

Jaipur is connected to major cities in India by a network of trains. The city has three major railway stations, namely Jaipur Junction, Gandhinagar Jaipur, and Durgapura. Several express trains and superfast trains run between Jaipur and other cities, making it an affordable and convenient mode of transportation. For more affordable option, we have cheap Jaipur packages that won‚Äôt break the bank

By Road

Jaipur is connected to major cities in North India by a network of national highways. There are several bus services that connect Jaipur to cities like Delhi, Agra, and Udaipur. Rajasthan State Road Transport Corporation (RSRTC) also operates regular buses to and from Jaipur.

Once you reach Jaipur, there are several options for local transportation, including taxis, auto-rickshaws, and buses.

3. Famous Food To Try In Jaipur

These are just a few of the many famous dishes to try in Jaipur. The city's rich culinary heritage offers a diverse range of delicious and unique flavors that are sure to delight your taste buds.

‚Ä¢ Dal Bati Churma - Popular Rajasthani dish consisting of lentil curry (dal), baked dough balls (bati), and sweetened churma.

‚Ä¢ Laal Maas - Spicy meat curry made with mutton or lamb and a blend of hot spices, including red chili powder, garlic, and ginger.

‚Ä¢ Ghewar - Traditional Rajasthani sweet made with flour, ghee, and sugar syrup. It is a round, disc-shaped dessert that is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

‚Ä¢ Pyaaz Kachori - A deep-fried snack that is stuffed with spiced onion filling.

‚Ä¢ Mawa Kachori - A deep-fried pastry that is stuffed with sweetened mawa and nuts, and is served with a sugar syrup drizzle.

‚Ä¢ Mirchi Vada - a spicy snack made with green chili peppers stuffed with potato filling, dipped in gram flour batter, and deep-fried.

‚Ä¢ Rajasthani Thali - A platter of traditional Rajasthani dishes, including dal, baati, churma, ker sangri, gatte ki sabzi, and more.

‚Ä¢ Ker Sangri - A traditional Rajasthani vegetable dish made with dried berries and beans.

‚Ä¢ Kadi - A yogurt-based curry that is made with gram flour and tempered with spices. It is usually served with steamed rice.

‚Ä¢ Kulfi - A popular frozen dessert made with sweetened milk and flavored with pistachios, saffron, and other ingredients.

4. Famous Places To Visit In Jaipur

These are just some of the top places to visit in Jaipur, but the city has many other interesting sites and experiences to offer as well. From the breathtaking Hawa Mahal and Amer Fort to the bustling Johari and Bazaars, each attraction is a testament to the city's vibrant colors, intricate architecture, and fascinating heritage.

1. Amber Fort

A stunning fort located on a hilltop, it offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. With its intricate carvings and sculptures, Amber Fort provides breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape and is a must-visit destination for any traveler looking to experience the grandeur of Rajasthan.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: architecture, elephant ride, night show

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Jagat Shiromani Temple, Nahargarh Fort, Jaigarh Fort

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, taxi, private vehicle

2. Hawa Mahal:

Also known as the "Palace of Winds," this beautiful palace is an iconic landmark of Jaipur. This iconic landmark was built in 1799 by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh with its striking pink-colored sandstone facade. This five-story structure has the perfect view of the city from any angle. A visit to Hawa Mahal is an experience that will stay with you forever! Explore it with our Jaipur holiday packages.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Cultural heritage

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: City Palace, Jal Mahal, Jantar Mantar, Chokhi Dhani Village, Amber Fort

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, taxi, private vehicle

3. City Palace

The sprawling palace complex is a must-visit for its impressive architecture and historical significance. Its remarkable architecture and captivating history make it a must-visit for anyone looking to explore the city's rich heritage. With its unique blend of Rajasthani and Mughal styles, it truly is a sight to behold.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: architecture, history, cultural

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Sree Ganesh Dhaam, Jantar Mantar, Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II Museum

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, taxi, private vehicle

4. Jantar Mantar

An astronomical observatory built in the 18th century, it is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Amongst the 19 large instruments of Jantar Mantar in Jaipur, the most popular one is the Samrat Yantra. It is highly renowned and its purpose is incredibly distinct.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Geometric devices, astronomical instruments

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Hawa Mahal, Goverdhan Temple, City Palace, Tripolia Gate

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, taxi, private vehicle

5. Nahargarh Fort

Nahargarh Fort is one of the most famous forts in Rajasthan that should be included in every Jaipur tour packages. It overlooks the city of Jaipur and offers a majestic view of the sunset. The fort has been witness to many battles and wars, but today it stands tall as one of the greatest symbols of Rajasthan's proud history. With its awe-inspiring architecture, it offers visitors a chance to explore the centuries-old culture and witness stunning views from its highest point.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: impressive views, History, architecture

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: City Palace, Jaipur Wax Museum, The Sculpture Park at Madhavendra Palace

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, taxi, private vehicle

6. Birla Mandir

Birla Mandir is an awe-inspiring temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Goddess Lakshmi. It is renowned for its intricate carvings, magnificent architecture, and beautiful sculptures that are a testament to the skill of Indian craftsmanship. This temple is one of the most popular attractions, you can visit it with our Jaipur city tour package.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Architecture, Pilgrim site

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Dadavadi Mandir, Megha Katan Bazaar

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, taxi, private vehicle

7. Albert Hall Museum:

A popular museum that houses an impressive collection of art, artifacts, and sculptures. The Albert Hall Museum in Jaipur is a place that cannot be missed for its beauty and amazing collection of artifacts. It is the oldest and most renowned museum in Rajasthan, making it a must-visit location when in Jaipur with Jaipur travel package.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Architectural beauty

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Jaipur Zoo, Dolls Museum, Ram Niwas Garden, Peacock Garden

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, taxi, private vehicle

8. Jaigarh Fort:

Jaigarh Fort is an impressive sight to behold. Located atop a hill, this historically rich fort offers visitors breathtaking views of Jaipur city. It also houses a museum that displays the history of weaponry and armory used by the Rajputs in ancient India. Whether you are a history buff or just looking for an amazing view, Jaigarh Fort will certainly not disappoint!

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Architecture, Ram Harihar Temple

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Nahargarh Fort, Panna Meena ka Kund, Man Sagar Lake, Amber Fort

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, taxi, private vehicle

9. Chokhi Dhani:

An exciting cultural village that provides a unique experience of Rajasthani culture, food, and customs. This amazing cultural village brings together traditional music, dance, art, and cuisine to create an unforgettable experience. Visitors can explore the vibrant colors of this vibrant culture while also enjoying delicious local cuisine. Chokhi Dhani is a great way to immerse oneself in the rich culture and traditions of Rajasthan. Must visit this place with our Jaipur tour package.

‚Ä¢ What‚Äôs Special: Village resort

‚Ä¢ Tourist Spots: Patrika Gate, Jawahar Circle Garden, Gyan Museum, Jain Mandir Sanganer

‚Ä¢ Transportation: Bus, taxi, private vehicle

ldJsonArray.answer2: Ladakh is well connected by air, and the nearest airport is Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport in Leh. You can catch direct flights from major Indian cities like Delhi, Mumbai, and Srinagar.

ldJsonArray.question3: What are the must-visit attractions in Ladakh?
ldJsonArray.answer3: Ladakh offers a plethora of attractions, including Pangong Lake, Nubra Valley, Leh Palace, Hemis Monastery, Thiksey Monastery, and Magnetic Hill. Don‚Äôt forget to explore the local culture and markets in Leh.

ldJsonArray.question4: Is Ladakh a safe destination for solo travellers?
ldJsonArray.answer4: Ladakh is generally considered safe for solo travellers. The local people are friendly and welcoming. However, it‚Äôs essential to acclimatise to the high altitude slowly and take precautions for altitude sickness.

ldJsonArray.question5: How should I prepare for the high-altitude environment in Ladakh?
ldJsonArray.answer5: To prepare for the high-altitude environment in Ladakh, it‚Äôs crucial to acclimatise slowly by spending a day or two in Leh before heading to higher-altitude areas. Drink plenty of water, avoid alcohol, and carry medications for altitude sickness if needed. Dress in layers to adapt to temperature changes and protect yourself from the strong sun.

title: Uttrakhand Tour Packages
description: Get the best Uttarakhand holiday packages with the best discounts and deals. Plan your trip with our budget packages to Uttarakhand. Book now & save more!
keywords: uttarakhand holiday tour packages, best uttarakhand tour packages, budget packages to uttarakhand
shortpackagedesc:
Uttarakhand Tour Package

Uttarakhand has remarkable tourist locations and activities, with options for travelers of all types and budgets. The countless tour packages, prices, and ticket options for various areas, resorts, and cities make Uttarakhand one of the world's top vacation destinations.
longpackagedesc:
1. Best Time To Visit Uttarakhand

Although Uttarakhand welcomes tourists any time of year, soaking up the region's lush and beautiful environs is the ideal time to do so during the summer. When the heat of the cities of India becomes unbearable, Uttarakhand's snow-covered mountains can provide a much-needed respite from the heat.

For those seeking an exciting interest in a vibrant atmosphere, winter is the best season to visit this location with our Uttarakhand tour packages. But, you should only come to this location during the off-season, since rainy weather often leads to landslides, traffic jams, and delays.

Below, you'll see what is the best time to see the beautiful scenery of Uttarakhand. You can explore our affordable Uttarakhand tour packages from Delhi for your next trip to Uttarakhand.

Summer Season (March - June)

March to June signals that it is time to expel winter and get nearer to summer. As the temperature rises from 20 degrees Celsius to 35 degrees Celsius, the setting is enlivened by the presence of nature and is fun to explore for trekking and other physical activities.

Monsoon Season (July - September)

With the weather hovering between 15 degrees Celsius and 25 degrees Celsius, the months of July to September bring heavy rainfalls in Uttarakhand. As the transport disruptions brought on by landslides and road closures may limit your trips, it's not advised to visit Uttarakhand during the monsoon season.

Winter Season (October - February)

You can find the wintertime in Uttarakhand from October to February. The climate is tremendously cold during this time. No matter what sort of winter vacation you're thinking about.

2. How to Reach Uttarakhand?

For traveling within the state of Uttarakhand, there are several available options. Individuals can travel by train, bus, or taxi; and if they're looking to go from one region to another, another option is to charter a taxi, ride on a cycle rickshaw, take an auto-rickshaw, or book a bus package. Exist nationwide tour packages to Uttarakhand.

By Air

Uttarakhand is easy to access from high-rises in many other cities across India. Both of these airports typically offer only a few flights at certain times of the day, so it is important to do your research to make sure that it is a good option for you.

By Train

It is incredibly easy to reach Uttarakhand by train from anywhere in the world. There are Express and other public transportation routes that can depart from Delhi, Lucknow, Varanasi, Kolkata, and other major cities.

By Road

Traveling by road is one of the chief choices when planning to visit Uttarakhand since an extensive road network covers the entire territory. From Delhi and other neighboring states.

3. Famous Dishes Of Uttarakhand

Uttarakhand Cuisine offers you a tantalizing mixture of spicy tastes with a delicate aroma in their famous hill stations, such as Panch Phoron and Khas-Khas spices. During your trip to Uttarakhand hill stations, you could be fortunate enough to enjoy the aroma of Panch Phoron, curry spices that will forever and truly reside in your taste buds.

‚Ä¢ Kafuli - Popular dish of Kafuli, which combines several green leafy vegetables. It is a mixture of various green vegetables that is a nutritional powerhouse.

‚Ä¢ Phaanu - A popular dish of Uttarakhand, Phaanu is a blend of various legumes. Served with rice which is sure to make an impression on your taste buds.

‚Ä¢ Baadi - It is a mixture of taste and nutrition, and it is perceived as one of the best local foods of the Garhwal region in Uttarakhand.

‚Ä¢ Aaloo Tamatar Ka Jhol - Aaloo Tamatar Ka Jhol is one of the clear sensations from the menu of Uttrakhand's well-liked cuisine. A spicy, aromatic blend of indescribable taste and fast preparation, this dish is one of the specialties that stand out among the region's cuisines..

‚Ä¢ Chainsoo - This dish contains a great deal of protein and essential nutrients. The Chainsoo dining experience is slow to gratify but happily worth trying!

‚Ä¢ Dubuk - Made from Arhar Ki Dal that's been slowly cooked in a kadhai and served. It truly is outstanding, especially during the winter.

‚Ä¢ Jhangora Ki Kheer - Millet is a distinctive main ingredient of the state's famous recipe, its richness in texture and nutrition is due in part to milk.

‚Ä¢ Garhwal Ka Fannah - This dish is known as a staple of Mussoorie cuisine. The delicacy is not only nourishing but also pleasing to look at.

‚Ä¢ Gulgula - Gulgula is a snack or dessert comprised of jaggery. This sweet is widely known in North India.

‚Ä¢ Singori - This is a sweet dish in Uttarakhand made with Khoa. This particular dish is wrapped in the Maalu leaf and served as an appetizer in the Kumaon areas.

4. Famous Places To Visit In Uttarakhand

Uttarakhand is the perfect place for any adventurous individual looking to cross the mountains of the Himalayas, daring enough to ski on the snow, and willing to adventure into her own self. Our Uttarakhand tour packages from Delhi are designed with adventure-seekers in mind, which provide guests an excellent excuse to visit.

1. Mussorie

The queen of hill stations, Mussoorie has located a short distance from Dehradun. Offering a breathtaking view of the Shivalik hills, the town is renowned for shopping, temples, and bookstores. You will always find a place for Mussoorie in our Uttarakhand holiday tour packages itineraries.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Mystic hills, beautiful waterbody

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Mall road, Laal Tibba Scenic Point

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

2. Nainital

Nestled between the emerald green Naini Lake and the Mall Road of the Kumaon region of Uttarakhand, this hill station is renowned for its perfect attractions, boating facilities, a stunning zoo, and Raj Bhawan. Sari River and the Naini Lake Valley lack the village's villages.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Naini Lake, Hanuman Garhi, Tibetan Market

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Kamaltal, Bhimtal

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

3. Rishikesh

Rishikesh is known for its spiritual aura as well as its adventures. Thousands and thousands of people flock to Rishikesh each year because of their search for spiritual awareness, and to enjoy adventurous activities.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Triveni Ghat, Temples

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Laxman Jhula, Parmarth Niketan Ashram, Ram Jhula

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

4. Jim Corbett National Park

Oldest national park in India, and it is home to enormous animals like elephants, tigers, deer, and so on. Situated in the foothills of the Himalayas, this national park is open all year round, with the exception of the monsoon season. A jeep safari allows you to get up close with the animals that are wild there.

‚Ä¢ Famous For: Jeep Safari, Wildlife

‚Ä¢ Must-Visit Places: Corbett Meusum, Girija Devi Temple

‚Ä¢ Transportation Options: Private cabs, buses

5. Auli

Auli is a great place for people who are seeking peace, adventure, and tranquility. Auli has the best skiing available in the country, where you are exquisitely impressed by the white snow and magnificent views of Himalayan peaks from the top.

ldJsonArray.question1: What makes Uttarakhand a unique travel destination?
ldJsonArray.answer1: Uttarakhand is renowned for its stunning Himalayan landscapes, diverse flora and fauna, and spiritual significance. It offers a unique blend of adventure, culture, and natural beauty.

ldJsonArray.question2: What are the best times to visit Uttarakhand?
ldJsonArray.answer2: The best time to visit Uttarakhand depends on your interests. Summer (March to June) is ideal for trekking and sightseeing, while winter (October to February) is perfect for snow sports. The monsoon season (July to September) is best avoided due to heavy rainfall.

ldJsonArray.question3: What are the top tourist attractions in Uttarakhand?
ldJsonArray.answer3: Uttarakhand boasts a wide range of attractions, including the spiritual town of Rishikesh, the scenic beauty of Nainital, the adventure hub of Auli, and the divine temples of Badrinath and Kedarnath.

ldJsonArray.question4: What adventure activities can I enjoy in Uttarakhand?
ldJsonArray.answer4: Uttarakhand offers thrilling adventure activities such as trekking, river rafting, paragliding, skiing, and wildlife safaris. It's a paradise for adventure enthusiasts.

ldJsonArray.question5: How can I plan a spiritual journey in Uttarakhand?
ldJsonArray.answer5: To embark on a spiritual journey, you can visit revered temples like Kedarnath, Badrinath, Yamunotri, and Gangotri. We can help you plan a pilgrimage package tailored to your needs.

ldJsonArray.question1: What is Gulmarg famous for?
ldJsonArray.answer1: Gulmarg is renowned for its breathtaking natural beauty, including lush meadows, snow-capped mountains, and a serene environment. It's a popular destination for skiing, trekking, and golfing.

ldJsonArray.question2: When is the best time to visit Gulmarg?
ldJsonArray.answer2: The best time to visit Gulmarg depends on your interests. For winter sports like skiing and snowboarding, the winter months from December to February are ideal. If you prefer pleasant weather and blooming flowers, visit during the spring and summer months from April to June.

ldJsonArray.question3: What activities can I enjoy in Gulmarg?
ldJsonArray.answer3: Gulmarg offers a range of activities, including skiing in the winter, trekking and mountain biking in the summer, and golfing at one of the highest golf courses in the world. You can also take the Gulmarg Gondola, one of the highest cable cars in the world, for stunning views.

ldJsonArray.question4: Are there any cultural attractions in Gulmarg?
ldJsonArray.answer4: While Gulmarg is primarily known for its natural beauty and outdoor activities, you can also explore the local culture by visiting nearby villages and interacting with the friendly locals. The town of Gulmarg itself has a few small markets and eateries.

ldJsonArray.question5: How can I reach Gulmarg?
ldJsonArray.answer5: The nearest major airport to Gulmarg is Srinagar International Airport, which is well-connected to major Indian cities. From Srinagar, you can hire a taxi or take a shared cab to reach Gulmarg. The journey offers scenic views.

ldJsonArray.question1: What is the best time to visit Kasol?
ldJsonArray.answer1: The best time to visit Kasol is during the summer months from March to June and the autumn months from September to November when the weather is pleasant for outdoor activities and trekking.

ldJsonArray.question2: Which is the best destinations to visit in Kasol?
ldJsonArray.answer2: In Kasol, must-visit destinations include the Parvati River, Kheerganga trek, Tosh village, Malana, Rasol, Chalal, and Manikaran Sahib Gurudwara for their scenic beauty and cultural richness.

ldJsonArray.question3: what are the famous street food of Kasol?
ldJsonArray.answer3: Kasol's street food scene offers delights like Israeli cuisine - falafel, hummus, shakshuka, Tibetan momos, and local favorites like thukpa.

ldJsonArray.question4: How many days do you need for a Kasol trip?
ldJsonArray.answer4: For a comprehensive Kasol trip, plan for at least 3-4 days to explore the region, enjoy the treks, soak in the culture, and experience the tranquility.

ldJsonArray.question5: What should I wear on a trip to Kasol?
ldJsonArray.answer5: For a trip to Kasol, pack comfortable clothing suitable for the weather - light layers for daytime warmth and something warmer for the evenings. Trekking essentials and comfortable footwear are also recommended.
